discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is the answer

questions.question_text: Identify the setup that allows news and information of interest to be published to suppliers through the Oracle Supplier Portal Cloud.

choices.D: enabling RSS feed from a customers’ corporate web portal
choices.C: setting up Specify Supplier News Content in the Functional Setup Manager.
choices.A: configuring the "News Broadcast" field using the ‘Manage Supplier’ task
choices.B: enabling feed from social media sites such as Facebook, Twitter, and so on using ‘Manage Common Options for Purchasing’
The particular item is defined as "BOM Enabled’ in PIM.
choices.C: The particular item is not part of any Procurement catalog.
choices.A: The particular item is not defined as a ‘Transactable’ item in PIM.
choices.E: The particular item does not belong to any Purchasing Category.
choices.D: The particular item has not been marked as a ‘Purchased’ item within the Purchasing operational attribute group.

questions.question_text: In Self Service Procurement, a user is not able to search for one of the inventory items. Identify three configuration issues that could be causing this problem.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDE
For me is C-D-E
I think it's CDE too, but I'm not sure

choices.C: The negotiation outcome is defined as ‘Contract Purchase Agreement’ in the negotiation template.
choices.D: The Profile Option PO_PRC_AGENT_CATEGORY_ASSIGNMENT is set to the current user.
choices.B: The Business Function for the associated Business Unit is ‘Requisition Only’ and did not allow Purchase Agreement Generation.
choices.A: The negotiation outcome is defined as ‘Blanket Purchase Agreement’ in the negotiation template.

questions.question_text:
On completion of a Negotiation Award using a negotiation template, you are trying to create a purchasing document and system provides you the option to create a Blanket Purchase Agreement (BPA) only, whereas you expected to get an option to create a Contact Purchase Agreement (CPA).
Identify the reason for this.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A for sure

choices.D: fulfillment order line to the extensible flexfield attributes
choices.C: extensible flexfield attributes to the fulfillment order line
choices.A: enterprise business object attributes to the fulfillment order line
choices.B: extensible flexfield attributes to the enterprise business object attributes

questions.question_text: During implementation, the transformation maps that are associated with external-facing interfaces must be modified to map the ______.

Your customer tells you that in their industry, the response document for an auction is called a Proposal instead of the default Oracle term Bid, and that they would like to have all their negotiation documents reflect this terminology. What would you do to meet this requirement?

discussion.content:
A: When creating a negotiation style, you can create alternate labels for the category manager-side or supplier-side
documents. Then any negotiation document created using that style replaces the default labels with the labels
you created in the style. These replacements appear both in the online application and any printed versions of the
document.
You can override the Response display name from Bid to user-defined in this case proposal under the manage negotiation style.
A is the only correct answer
A & B are the correct choices
